quest.name: Steppe of Hard Knocks
journal: Maqali's son should have returned by now.

dialogue.name: MAQALI
dialogue.text: Ah, if it isn't the khagan herselfhimself.

dialogue.name: MAQALI
dialogue.text: I am sorry to trouble you, but could I ask you to check on my son? I sent him to the Dawn Throne on an errand and he should have returned by now.

dialogue.name: MAQALI
dialogue.text: Word has it that there are some Oronir who resent the fact that our tribe triumphed in the Naadam. I worry that one of them may have done something to my boy.

dialogue.name: MAQALI
dialogue.text: Please ask Chagur as to my son's whereabouts. She should know if he is safe or not. I do hope I am worrying for nothing...

dialogue.name: MAQALI
dialogue.text: Please ask Chagur as to my son's whereabouts. She should know if he is safe or not. I do hope I am worrying for nothing...

dialogue.name: CHAGUR
dialogue.text: Ah, khagan. To what do we owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: CHAGUR
dialogue.text: Yes, Maqali's son was here just a short while ago. The last I saw he was heading westwards with some hunters.

dialogue.name: CHAGUR
dialogue.text: I do not imagine there is aught to worry about, but check on him by all means should you be concerned.

dialogue.name: CHAGUR
dialogue.text: I do not imagine there is aught to worry about, but check on him by all means should you be concerned. He was headed off to the west the last time I saw him.

dialogue.name: SON02803
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> I cannot continue. My hands are covered in blisters. Wait, you are the khagan, are you not? What brings you here?

dialogue.name: SON02803
dialogue.text: Father was truly that worried? After completing my errand, I began talking with these hunters, and they invited me to train with them.

dialogue.name: BUDUGA02803
dialogue.text: I had always looked down on the Mol, but it was we who lost. There must be some secret to their strength. Come on, let us go another round!

dialogue.name: SON02803
dialogue.text: My apologies but Father awaits my return. Perhaps I can join you again when my hands are not so sore. Thank you for the invitation.

dialogue.name: ORONIR02803
dialogue.text: He must be hiding his true strength from us. There is no way we could have been defeated by such a weak tribe.

dialogue.name: MAQALI
dialogue.text: I just spoke with my son. I could not ask him too much as he was keen to hurry off and get his hands bandaged up. What exactly happened?

dialogue.name: MAQALI
dialogue.text: Ha ha, truly? No doubt the experience will serve him well.

dialogue.name: MAQALI
dialogue.text: Perhaps that kind of training is exactly what he needs to become a strong warrior like yourself. He may not like it, but he shall need to suffer if he wants to grow stronger.
